meanings.definition: A person who belittles or disparages others.
meanings.sent1: The belittlers in the group always made fun of others.
meanings.sent2: She felt hurt by the comments of the belittlers in the room.
meanings.sent3: The belittlers at the party thought they were being funny, but it just made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The belittlers were like tiny bullies, always trying to make others feel small.
meanings.sent5: The belittlers' words were like tiny daggers, piercing through people's confidence.

meanings.sent1: He would often belittle his classmates to make himself feel superior.
meanings.sent2: It's not nice to belittle someone's achievements.
meanings.sent3: She would jokingly belittle her own cooking skills, even though she was a great chef.
meanings.sent4: His constant belittling of others only showed his own insecurities.
meanings.sent5: The boss's constant belittling tone made the employees dread coming to work.
